utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: House? House? Oh! My God! What the hell?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Muahahahaaaaahhh Gotcha.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Did you actually wake up early and hide under the bed just to scare the crap outta me?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Set an alarm and everything.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: It's like dating a ten-year-old.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: God, I hope not. Now that we're down here…

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Hold that thought.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Seriously?

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: I have to pee.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I'll wait. I brought a book. I didn't know what time your alarm was set for.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: House?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You know, you can rent this space out down here. In Japan, that would be like a deluxe—

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: House, shut up. There's blood in my urine.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: You really don't have to be here.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You're my girlfriend. I'm being supportive.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: I'm mainly talking about them.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Well, given that there's almost certainly nothing wrong with you, and my patient definitely has something wrong with him—

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: That can't wait an hour?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: 'Fraid not. He's… Chase.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: 16-year-old male spit up blood during a pick-up basketball game. E.R. couldn't find the source in his lungs or GI tract.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: See? Serious.

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: Could be vasculitis, bronchiectasis, inhaled particles.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: What about angiodysplasia?

utterance.speaker: Urologist
utterance.content: Ready when you are…

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Get them outta here. My urethra is not for public entertainment.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: But it is a good-time adjacent. Feed the kid a camera. Check his gut for angiodysplasia.

utterance.speaker: Urologist
utterance.content: All right. If you could scoot down.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Hey, I'm, uh, I'm missing a watch. So can you keep your eyes open while—

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Okay! You too.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: This little camera transmits images to the data recorder so we can see if you've got any vascular malformations in your GI tract. Your records show you've lost some weight over the past year. Was that intentional?

utterance.speaker: Ryan
utterance.content: Not really.

utterance.speaker: Todd
utterance.content: Well, he's been eating less since he quit the swim team.

utterance.speaker: Ryan
utterance.content: You have to get up early for swim. It wasn't fun anymore.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: I need to talk to your son about sexual activity. Generally, it's less embarrassing for everyone—

utterance.speaker: Kay
utterance.content: We're leaving.

utterance.speaker: Ryan
utterance.content: Actually, I've only—

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: How long have you been cutting yourself?

utterance.speaker: Ryan
utterance.content: Those are from a layback grind that went wrong. Came off my skateboard straight into a fence.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: So… no to cutting but yes to appetite and sleep changes, and you quit something you used to enjoy. How long have you been depressed?

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Imaging showed no sign of upper GI issues. But the kid did admit to being depressed and to smoking pot to take the edge off.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You are very pleased with yourself, aren't you?

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: His marijuana could be laced with formaldehyde or lead, which could cause a pulmonary hemorrhage which could make him spit up blood. Yes. Yes, I am. I thought it was a good catch.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Run a lead level and push 5 liters IV fluid.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Feel free to tip your other server.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Cystoscopy was clean. Cytopathology was normal.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Why do you have my lab results?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I don't. If I did, I'd know you were fine.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Unless the blood came from my kidneys.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Come on. Your hypochondriac mom had a brush with mortality last month, and it's understandable that you're worrying more than usual, worrying that you might turn into her.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: You're right. Odds are, this is nothing.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Meet me in the cafeteria in ten. There'll be a corn dog with your name on it. I mean an actual corn dog. They fixed the deep fryer.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: I need to schedule an ultrasound.

utterance.speaker: Ryan
utterance.content: My dad's head's still in one piece, so I'm guessing you didn't mention the pot. What'd you tell him?

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: The truth. You had a… minor chemical exposure, and we can't be 100% sure how it happened.

utterance.speaker: Ryan
utterance.content: Thanks for covering.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: I know what it's like to be 16.

utterance.speaker: Ryan
utterance.content: You also know what it's like to be depressed. You figured out my deal after only a few minutes, but I been fooling my friends and parents for months.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: It's my job to notice things. Maybe talking to your parents would make things better.

utterance.speaker: Ryan
utterance.content: I've tried. They take it personally that I'm not happy, and then I end up having to make them feel better. They don't get me. No one does.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: In Med School, it seemed like everybody else could handle the pressure. I couldn't. I ended up hurting myself. Stupidest thing I've ever done. You've got red spots in your eyes. They weren't there before.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: You have nice skin.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Thank you. Shut up!

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Sorry. Just thought it would be rude not to comment.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Just treat me like any other patient.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Right. Are you sucking in your stomach?

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: No. Hurry up before I pass out.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Wilson?

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Ultrasound isn't definitive. We should run other tests before—

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Stop talking like a doctor and tell me what you see.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: There's a mass in your kidney.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: We still don't know why Ryan coughed blood, and now he's got small hemorrhages in his eyes.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Sounds like an acquired coagulopathy, which gives us a pretty wide differential.

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: Gets a lot narrower if we factor in his depression.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Oh, don't do that!

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: Mood swings can be a symptom of physiological illness.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I'm not talking to you.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Mood swings are also a symptom of adolescence along with emo music and masturbation. More importantly, his weight loss and sleeping issues started a year ago.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Infection makes the most sense. He shoots hoops at school, showers in the locker room. I'm thinking staph.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Damn!

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: You don't think—

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Not talking to you!

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Everything okay with Cuddy?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: She's fine. She's just too stupid to accept it. Start him on nafcillin for staph.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: All that's in the, uh, First Mutual safety deposit box. The retirement accounts—

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You're freaking out because of one ultrasound performed by an incompetent Bonobo monkey.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: As demonstrated by my sitting here calmly going about my business.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Calling a lawyer, drafting a will! Okay. I-I… hacked into your online schedule. Look, tests always show something. A mass in your kidney could be a complex cyst. It could be benign.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: I'm a single mom. I need to set up a trust, appoint a guardian. It's silly that I haven't done it before now.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: But you're doing it now because you think you're sick. The freaking out can at least wait until after the biopsy this afternoon.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: The biopsy's not till tomorrow. It's the first opening in the schedule.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: For the Dean of Medicine, the first opening in the schedule is… Oh, look! Now.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: My worry isn't any more important than anyone else's.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Actually, it is.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: But I'm not sick, right?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Good point.

utterance.speaker: Roid Rage
utterance.content: I want my stuff, asshat.

utterance.speaker: Ryan
utterance.content: I told you, man, I don't have it here.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Hey… guys. Everything okay?

utterance.speaker: Roid Rage
utterance.content: On my way out. I'll see you later.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: You wanna… tell me what's going on?

utterance.speaker: Ryan
utterance.content: My friend gave me some leftover Klonopin he had when he switched his seizure meds. I sold them to Roid Rage for 80 bucks, but I landed in here before I could deliver, and now he's gonna rip my arms off.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: How often do you sell drugs?

utterance.speaker: Ryan
utterance.content: It was a one-time thing. I needed the cash, I had the pills, so I thought, "why not?" It was a bad idea. The pills are at my house. I could have a friend go get them.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Give the thug his money back. One time only.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: I mean, if you're okay with this. You have three kids of your own.

utterance.speaker: Julia
utterance.content: It's not even a question. Of course I'll be Rachel's guardian. And House is cool with this? I mean, you guys…

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: We've only been together a few months.

utterance.speaker: Julia
utterance.content: Hmm. Seems like a lot longer. Probably because you've been talking about him for ten years. And by talking, I mean ranting about wanting to smash his teeth in with a stapler for being such a jerk.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: People change.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: I'll get it.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: That better be her!

utterance.speaker: Sitcom Studio Audience
utterance.content: Ooh!

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Rachel Cuddy, you were supposed to be home half an hour ago.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Don't blame me — he's the one who wouldn't run any red lights.

utterance.speaker: Cop
utterance.content: Mouth on that kid makes Mel Gibson sound like Nelson Mandela. Where'd she learn that?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I don't know why you're here, but I didn't do it.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: What's the problem, officer?

utterance.speaker: Cop
utterance.content: She was shoplifting down at the mall.

utterance.speaker: Sitcom Studio Audience
utterance.content: Aw!

utterance.speaker: Cop
utterance.content: Are either of you this girl's father?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Nope. But since her mom died, she's my favorite tax write-off. Officer, you have my word it won't happen again. 'Cause next time… she won't get caught!

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: It's no big deal.

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: Good for you. You could have just assumed he was a drug dealer, but instead you took his word for it. It's nice to finally see someone have a little faith in humanity around here.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Why would you do that? Ryan, you okay in there?

utterance.speaker: Ryan
utterance.content: I'm not sure. I think I just peed blood.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Looks like peeing blood is the new black.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Peeing blood after a night on antibiotics means we can move on from infections.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Scoping showed no sign of a bleed in his bladder, which points to a kidney problem.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Probably some kinda mass.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Kidney mass wouldn't explain the coughing blood or the hemorrhages. Antiphospholipid syndrome, on the other hand…

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Makes sense. But doesn't rule out a mass.

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: You think it's cancer?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Mass doesn't have to be cancer. Could be renal hematoma.

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: But the patient doesn't have any other abdominal trauma.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: He's… not talking about the patient.

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: Cuddy has a mass on her kidney?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: It's probably just a complex cyst or angiomyolipoma.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: It's a mass, not a mystery. They'll do the biopsy, then you'll have your answer. Just… have to wait.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Patient admitted to using pot. Who knows what else he's doing. This could be a heroin-induced nephropathy.

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: I thought you trusted this kid.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: And then you pointed out how sweet that was.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: If it were heroin, he'd be going through withdrawal. Antiphospholipid syndrome's a better fit. Start the patient on plasmapheresis.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: While he's doing that, can I at least search his house for drugs?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Have I ever said no to that question?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: What are you doing here?

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Pie-eating contest.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Cuddy's biopsy is in an hour. You should be keeping her company.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Okay. You've been worried that your relationship is getting in the way of your diagnoses, you're protecting your patient. Either that or… you're an ass.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Three — I hate the smell of death.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: The chances of Cuddy having renal cell carcinoma—

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I'm talking about our relationship. She needs support and comfort, both things that I famously suck at. This will inevitably lead to—

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: You know what's good for that? Practice. Doing it — I don't know — once?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I'm not gonna act like there's a crisis before we know there is one. There's no proof there's anything wrong with her.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: There's no proof she's being stalked by Ninja squirrels either, but if she's scared of them… as her boyfriend, it's your job to figure out how to help her feel better.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You're right.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: House told me to keep you company. Nurse told me to give you antibiotics.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Tell House I'm fine.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Mm! Tom Cruise got married. Do you want me to quote from First Corinthians? 'Cause I can do that.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: As a Jew, I'm gonna have to decline that offer.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Don't know what you're missing. St. Paul was really on his game. He'll show up eventually.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: You don't actually believe that. But I do. All these years, he's never stopped trying to annoy me for more than 15 minutes. And now he can't even walk into the room.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Love hopes all things.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: What is it with you and this kid?

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: He's doggy paddling in a sea of misery. I remember what it's like.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: How far did you have to reach back for that memory, last night? Sometimes I hear you in the living room watching TV at 3:00 a.m.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Yeah. If only they had some device that allowed you to record them and watch them another time. I'm just saying… I don't think fixing this kid is gonna fix you. Yep? We're on our way back. Our patient lost all feeling in his right arm.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Look at this.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Chase? How'd it go with Cuddy? Chase?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Aah!

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Good thing I brought my ax cane.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: House… help me!

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I'm coming!

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: House… please!

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: It looks like we got company.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Aah.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: House! Aah… aah!

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: No!

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Ah…

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: Are you okay?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I was sleeping. What could go wrong?

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: Patient lost feeling in his arm while on steroids — rules out autoimmune.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: So what causes bleeding, kidney problems, and unilateral numbness?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: And a complete absence of any record of Cuddy's kidney biopsy. She must have put it under a false name so I couldn't rush the results.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: What if we had it backwards and it's not a bleeding problem, it's a clotting problem?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: There's no patient file created in the last two days for anyone having that procedure.

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: She backdated the file? That's very clever.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Hands off. She's mine.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Clots could explain everything including the numbness. We should do an angiogram of his brain, see if we can find it.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: House. We're worried too.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: How sweet. I'm not worried. I just wanna get the results so she can stop worrying.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Okay, but in the meantime—

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Do an angiogram. You two go to pathology and look at Cuddy's slides.

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: You just said you didn't know which sample was hers.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I guess you're gonna have to look at them all.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Bigger question — what's the deal with Taub? Just because House is too distracted to notice your distraction doesn't mean we didn't.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Clots, angiograms — I'm focused. The kid scratched out the faces of half his class. You don't think that's a problem?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: It's not our problem.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Why is it anyone's problem? I violently executed my tenth grade geometry teacher about five different ways in my mind.

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: I didn't want to kill anybody. I just wanted to torture them slowly in my basement, preferably with acid. You guys ever think about what you might to do House?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Maybe it's no big deal.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Unless it is. Someone shot House.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: What are you doing?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Pie-eating contest.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: I was going to send Chase to tell you what the obvious right thing to do here is, but then I realized… if you were too stupid to know how stupid that was, you might miss the irony. You have to be with her.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Yeah. I get it. She needs artificial support for an artificial problem. She's fine.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: She doesn't sleep with Chase.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: We don't know that. Hey! Eating pie in here.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: House… I'm not gonna tell you a third time. Do not screw this up. Because I really don't wanna clean up the mess.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: He's referring to the pie.

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: Fourteen patients with kidney biopsies. I tabulated them against their urinalysis results. Six men, three diabetics, one LCDD, one kid, two seniors, and by default, one… Cuddy. Uh… the biopsy was inconclusive. The mass is near the center of her kidney. They couldn't get a readable sample.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Means they'll have to remove the mass to know if it's cancer or not.

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: The file says they're doing some imaging now, give the surgeon a better idea of what he's dealing with.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Can we order pizza? There's nothing in the fridge. At least not anymore. What's happening with the patient?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Angio showed a clot in a branch of his middle cerebral artery. Started him on streptokinase to break it up. Although… maybe we should have just played a few rounds of Savagescape 2: The Revenge, because that's obviously the best way to make someone feel better.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You keep talking like Wilson, your face will freeze like that.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Look, however bad you think you're gonna be in that room, not being in the room is worse. When she breaks up with you… you're playing by yourself.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Honey, I'm home.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Just in time. Pot roast is ready.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Smells wonderful!

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I cured all my patients, so I came home to spend time with Rachel.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: And how was your day today?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: It was great, Ma! I got 100% on my spelling test and 170 on my LSATs!

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Your LSATs? You're eight years old.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: We've been studying together. It was supposed to be a surprise.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Well, that's wonderful.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I think Rachel deserves a treat.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: No, thanks, Daddy. It might spoil my appetite.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Well, who could that be?

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Delivery for you, Mrs. House. Happy 29th birthday.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: I'm not 29! You're not limping. This isn't possible. None of this is possible.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Girl can dream.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: You run out of sugar?

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Got your scans back from today.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Yeah. Okay.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: What's going on?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Imaging shows enhancing masses across multiple lobes of Cuddy's lungs.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: That's what kidney cancer looks like when it metastasizes.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: She's dead.

utterance.speaker: Ryan
utterance.content: What's up, losers? I hope you're enjoying being alive. Today's lesson: natural selection. Excellent system. Made us who we are today. But then we invented seat belts and grocery stores, things that keep idiots and weaklings alive.

utterance.speaker: Ryan
utterance.content: And let's be honest. Most of you don't really deserve it.

utterance.speaker: Ryan
utterance.content: Here's to the natural order. Yes! Whoo!

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Copied from his flash drive. Do I go to the cops?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Yes. "Officer, I'd like to report an assault. The victim was a pile of leaves."

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: It goes on. He talks about bombing his school.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Which you know because you stole his flash drive and broke into his house. How's that gonna play?

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: Ryan's not responding to streptokinase. We don't have very long before the damage becomes irreversible.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: So we either up his dosage or go into his head and get the clot out. Where's House?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Hopefully with Cuddy. She did just get some pretty awful news.

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: I called her. She doesn't know where he is either.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Have you seen House?

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: He left my place last night after you called. No one's seen him today. Any idea where he'd be?

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: And you're not… worried about that? He's not good with bad news.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Yes. I'm worried. But this isn't about House. It's about Cuddy. She's the one who could be dying, and he's trying to make this about himself. I'm not playing.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Okay…

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: She still believes he'll show up. He'll either get over himself and be who she needs him to be or he won't.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: We'd like to do an embolectomy. We'll run a corkscrew-shaped instrument into Ryan's brain and pull the clot out.

utterance.speaker: Kay
utterance.content: Okay. Have you talked to him about it?

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Yes. But I wanted to see you alone. I saw some videos that Ryan made a few weeks ago. He's blowing up pipe bombs and threatening people in his school.

utterance.speaker: Kay
utterance.content: Oh, God!

utterance.speaker: Todd
utterance.content: He was probably just messing around. Our son wouldn't hurt anybody.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: I'm not so sure.

utterance.speaker: Kay
utterance.content: I know this looks bad, but Ryan's a good kid. He's had a rough couple years since he started high school, but I really think he'll come out of it.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: He needs help.

utterance.speaker: Todd
utterance.content: Maybe he does, but if this gets out, he'll be suspended, maybe expelled. How about you focus on keeping him alive?

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: What are you gonna do?

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: What do you think I should do?

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: Pssh. Ha. So you can do the opposite? There are kids all over the country doing dumb, potentially violent things, but the percentage of them who would actually kill anybody is miniscule.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: So I shouldn't do anything.

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: Mmmm… while the odds are low, the fallout could be… huge. Tens or even hundreds of lives.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: So I should call the cops.

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: Of course, over-identification with the subject could skew the calculation towards being extra-protective. Or alternatively—

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: You suck at this.

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: Hate the statistics… not the statistician.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Give me a little more dye.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: There's the clot. It just disintegrated when you touched it.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: What was that thing?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I got a great idea where we should go.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: I don't want to hear it.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You're gonna love it. Australia's Finest. There's a great karaoke bar in Newark—

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: I hate karaoke.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: They got every — every song by every Aussie artist. Midnight Oil, Men at Work, Olivia Newton John.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: I do a mean version of Physical.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: And the barbecue shrimp is amazing.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: What about the fries?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Hot and salty and delicious. Talking about food made me hungry.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: You had candy in my other dreams.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Means you're stressed at work. All dream symbols mean you're stressed at work. Or castration anxiety.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: No. I was hoping… you'd figure out a way to handle all this. Maybe you can't because you're still a child.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I can do better.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Might be too late.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: House!

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Ah…

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I should have been here. Sorry.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: I knew you'd come.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: What was that thing, and why did it just dissolve in the middle of surgery?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Why is his liver shutting down? That thing in his brain goes away, the kid slips into a coma.

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: We started him on lactulose, but at the rate his liver function is declining, he'll be dead in a day. Should we page House?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: He's busy.

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: House can't do anything for her now. We need him! By his own logic—

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Patient's blood tests were negative for barbiturates or acetaminophen. He's not on a high protein diet.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: House couldn't concentrate on the case before she was dying. You think he's gonna get in the game now?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: If you don't make it, I won't sleep with anyone for at least a month.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Make it two.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Bitch.

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: A.I.P. can cause uremia, tank the liver.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: It causes abdominal cramping, not abdominal bleeding.

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: Oh, because fucosidosis was such a brilliant idea?

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Guys!

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Type 2 citrullinemia fits.

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: There are no signs of hyperlipidemia or pancreatitis.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Those can take years to emerge.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Closest we've gotten. Start him on IV sodium benzoate to reduce the ammonia levels in his blood. Run a genetic test for citrullinemia.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: ♪ ♫ Forget your troubles ♪♫ Forget your troubles The black has streaks of red in it.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: ♪♫ Forget your troubles come on, get happy There’s a red band around the Mad Hatter type top hat House is wearing. He tilts his face up toward the camera. He’s wearing a jacket and a huge, floppy, red bow tie. He taps his fingers on the head of his cane. He’s wearing fingerless, white gloves but the fingers look like they were sawed or ripped off. He’s wearing many silver rings including three that cover the entire middle finger of his right hand. His cufflinks and the buttons on his white vest/waistcoat are skulls.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: ♪♫ You better chase all your cares away House is sitting at the bottom of a white staircase. The lights come up as he leans back. On his left lapel he’s wearing a huge caduceus pin.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: ♪♫ Shout hallelujah, come on, get happy He opens his right hand, palm facing the camera, in an almost nonchalant gesture.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: ♪♫ Get ready for the judgment day He swings his hand down until it rests on his leg, holding his right thigh, as always. Two nurses are stretched out on the stairs above him. They’re wearing short, white robes with red at the neckline and white leggings with red bands around the top. They also have lots of red eye makeup on. Three masked surgeons, in white, sleeveless scrubs, are standing on the stairs. The bright red drawstrings on their pants look like splashes of blood. They have the same fingerless gloves as House and canes that they use to slowly point forward and then to the ground. Close up of Cuddy’s eye opening.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: ♪♫ The sun is shining, come on, get happy House is so brightly lit from behind that he’s hard to see. He tosses his cane, which is almost glowing, to his left hand. He holds it at arm’s length.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: ♪♫ The lord is waiting to take your hand The two nurses are working their way down the stairs. They’re seated the whole time and push off the step behind them with their arms. Their left feet go down to the next stair while they do high kicks with their right legs. On the next step it’s reversed, with the left leg swinging up. Behind them the surgeons dance down the staircase using lots of shoulder action. Their canes are debonair props as if they were in an old musical likeThe Band Wagon. House gestures as if he were doffing a plumed hat.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: ♪♫ Shout hallelujah, come on, get happy The shot behind House widens. There are 3 nurses sit-kicking down the stairs in front of the surgeons and two behind them.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: ♪♫ We're goin' to the promised… House walks down the stairs in tempo with the dancers. He winks.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: ♪♫ …land He thumps his cane on the floor. A flock of white doves flies up behind him as he switches the cane to his left hand, spreading his arm wide, and removes his hat with his right.

utterance.speaker: Chorus
utterance.content: ♪♫ We're heading across the river, wash your sins in the tide The floor is covered with thick fog. Three people are curled up on it. They wear long, dark red surgical robes. Their masks and caps, also red, cover their entire faces. Large, silver caduceus pins are at their collars in the center of their backs. They curl to the floor then up on their knees, arms open wide. The have even larger caduceus pins on the fronts of their gowns. Two of the red figures and two surgeons, who aren’t wearing shirts, wheel in Cuddy, lying on her gurney. They are next to it, on it and hanging from it as they whirl her in a circle. Behind her a few of the red figures look like supplicants, rising from the fog. The walls of the room have large, artistic medical drawings – anatomy, scans, etc. In the center, behind Cuddy, is the staircase which stretches to infinity. House stands at the bottom.

utterance.speaker: Chorus
utterance.content: ♪♫ It's all so peaceful on the other side House walks with her as the kneeling, red figures gesture and point to “the other side.”

utterance.speaker: Chorus
utterance.content: ♪♫ On the other side House takes aim with his cane and shoots. Glass, perhaps the camera lens, shatters. The mood changes from funereal to upbeat.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: ♪♫ Forget your troubles, come on, get happy The nurses do a Charleston-like dance as House approaches Cuddy’s gurney

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: ♪♫ You better chase all your cares away He waves his hand past his face with a wiggle of his fingers

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: ♪♫ Shout hallelujah, come on, get happy He holds his cane in both hands and keeps time with it

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: ♪♫ Get ready for the judgment day He tucks his cane under his arm, removes his hat and throws it aside. His hair is slicked down.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: ♪♫ Forget your troubles, come on, get happy A megaphone appears in his hand. He rocks back and forth as he sings into it. He’s standing on the end of the gurney, singing to Cuddy.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: ♪♫ You better chase all your cares away Chorus: ♪♫ Chase all your cares away House: ♪♫ Shout hallelujah, come on, get happy Several of the white-clad dancers hold the gurney in place, dancing from the waist up, as House rocks from side to side and the gurney rocks with him.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: ♪♫ Get ready The mood shifts again as a calliope joins the music. Some of the nurses leap into frame.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: ♪♫ For the judgment… Cuddy sits up, twice.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: ♪♫ …day The chorus starts to spin the gurney with House and Cuddy on it. White swirls appear, joined by red ones. They spin like a pinwheel. Cuddy sits up. She and House sit on the edge of the gurney watching the carnival atmosphere in front of them. The music has completely changed to match the look. Nurses with megaphones line the sides. A surgeon and several nurses following him ride tricycles toward House and Cuddy. There are large balloons in the air. The back wall has red and white stripes in an enormous fan pattern.

utterance.speaker: Chorus
utterance.content: Get happy. Get ready.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Get ready. House whispers into Cuddy’s ear. He lifts a gold lorgnette to watch the action better.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Get happy. Get happy. A magician’s bouquet of flowers appears in his hand. Cuddy is smiling broadly.

utterance.speaker: Chorus
utterance.content: Get ready, get ready. House is with the cavorting chorus. He leaps in the air. He is seated next to Cuddy, talking in her ear again. She laughs joyfully, throwing her head back.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Get ready! House is seated next to Cuddy again.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Get ready. Get happy. White light washes everything out. With a couple of chords, the mood becomes more somber again. Cuddy is seated on the gurney. She’s wearing a white satin gown and white opera gloves. A satin sheet is across her chest, hiding the bottom of the deep v-neck which is edged with rhinestones. It’s impossible to tell where the sheet leaves off and the skirt begins but it is enormous. It almost covers the entire surface and drapes nearly to the floor. There are four Klieg lights behind her. House is at a baby grand, playing slow, gentle chords. The nurses are in a pile on the floor in front of him.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: ♪♫ Forget your troubles, come on, get happy Cuddy is on her side on the floor, propped up on her left elbow. She reaches forward with her free arm.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: ♪♫ You better chase your cares away Playing the piano.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: ♪♫ Shout hallelujah, come on, get happy She rolls on the floor. One of the nurses is standing between her and the camera. She reaches in the other direction.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: ♪♫ Get ready for the judgment day .

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: ♪♫ The sun is shining, come on, get happy She arches off the floor. Surgeons on the gurney adjust the klieg lights. House’s cane is now a giant candy cane. He slashes it through the air dramatically. The chorus joins in from this point on, singing loudly. They may or may not be singing the words – only House and Cuddy’s voices can be clearly heard.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: ♪♫ The lord is waiting to take your hand Cuddy takes hold of the top of the cane.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: ♪♫ Shout hallelujah, come on, get happy House backs up, sweeping Cuddy across the floor with him. She stands and embraces him. One of the dancers, in a long white skirt and a surgical mask that covers his face, spins. Two of the nurses, behind him, are holding klieg lights facing up. In the background, the number of lights behind the gurney has multiplied.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: ♪♫ Get ready for the judgment day House dips Cuddy. As he rights her, he holds the candy cane aloft in one hand.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: ♪♫ Forget your troubles, come on, get happy Nurses are spinning around the lamp poles. Cuddy holds onto the cane, which House uses to spin her.

utterance.speaker: Chorus
utterance.content: ♪♫ Get ready for the judgment day Cuddy: ♪♫ Shout hallelujah come on, get happy House leads Cuddy to the stairs, using the cane. They run up the stairs. Nurses lean over the gurney in a circle. House looks up from between them.

utterance.speaker: Chorus
utterance.content: ♪♫ Get ready for the judgment ♪♫ Ready for the judgment ♪♫ Ready for the judgment ♪♫ Ready for the judgment Cuddy catches up with House on the stairs. He stops. She looks at him. The nurses are over the gurney again then House is standing behind it. Cuddy smiles, happily, then races ahead up the stairs. Images of House and the chorus continue to speed past.

utterance.speaker: Chorus
utterance.content: ♪♫ Ready for the— With a gasp, Cuddy wakes and sits up on the gurney. She’s alone in the room which is totally empty and black except for the stretcher in the center and the light shining brightly on her.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Hm.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Hi.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Hi.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Guess who doesn't have cancer? Me. Also you. Actually, you for sure. Me…

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: House.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Your tumor was benign. An oncocytoma. They cut it out. You'll be fine.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Then what was in my lungs?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Once they ruled out cancer, I remembered that your mom was allergic to antibiotics. So I had them test your blood, and your IGE levels were through the roof. Because the lung masses were an allergic reaction. So now you're off the antibiotics, your lungs should clear right up. I brought you something. Say hello to your tumor.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Ugh! Wait. There are so many things that I could be afraid of, and most of the time, I manage to… lock them up behind doors. But this happens… all those doors just burst open. You just figured something out about your patient, didn't you? Go. Do what you do.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Take him off the meds. He's got a staph infection.

utterance.speaker: Kay
utterance.content: You treated him for staph three days ago. It didn't work.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Bacteria already in his system responded. But once a door's been busted open, more just keep coming.

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: Oh! He's talking about an abscess.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: I got that.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: For the cheap seats, an abscess is a gooey little cream puff of infection. Probably burst when your little pride and homicidal joy took a hard foul.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: It's good news.

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: If we can find the door.

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: Which just leaves… what are you gonna do now?

utterance.speaker: Julia
utterance.content: All right. I put the rest of the soup in the freezer so you'll have some for later.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Thanks for everything.

utterance.speaker: Julia
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: Julia
utterance.content: Here you go.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: I got it.

utterance.speaker: Julia
utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Are you gonna tell mom?

utterance.speaker: Julia
utterance.content: So she can show up here to take care of you by harassing the housekeeper and criticizing your bathrobe? Yeah. I think I'm gonna wait a few years. Oh, and I moved your sleeping pills back in the medicine cabinet because I just worry. Rachel always calls them candy.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: You took Vicodin. When you came to my hospital room that night, you were stoned.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: How did you know?

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: How did I not know? How did I make myself forget for months that you're an addict? My subconscious was trying to tell me you could never get through this without drugs.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: It was a one-time thing.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: It's not about the pills, House. It's about what they mean.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I was scared because I thought my girlfriend might die.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: No. You don't take Vicodin because you're scared. You take it so you won't feel pain. Everything you've ever done is to avoid pain — drugs, sarcasm… Keeping everybody at arm's length so no one can hurt you.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: As opposed to everyone else in the world who goes looking for pain like it's buried treasure?

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Pain happens when you care. Y-you can't love someone without making yourself open to their problems, their fears. And you're not willing to do that.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I ca–I came to be with you.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: But you weren't with me, not really.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I wanted to be.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: That's not enough.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I can do better.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: I don't think you can. You'll choose yourself over everybody else over and over again, because that's just who you are. I'm sorry.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: No. No, no, no. Don't. Don't.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: I thought I could do this.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Don't. Please don't.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Good-bye, House.
